page.title: 16Dairy Farming
page.content: My name is Colin Ferkin and I live on Nanphysick Farm - a dairy farm typical of this area. Our farm has got seventy-four cows and forty-nine calves. The cows are milked twice a day; early in the morning and mid-afternoon. The cows give eight hundred litres of milk a day. They are milked by electric machines and the milk goes into a jar then travels through pipes into a steel tank. Later a tanker collects the milk and it is taken to Lostwithiel. My dad owns a hundred and thirty acres and he rents twenty acres. He grows: thirty-two acres of arable silage (barley, peas & grass); fifty-one acres of silage; eight acres of tyfon; thirty-eight acres for grazing; four acres of hay; an acre of potatoes and two acres of woodland. (Colin Ferkin)
